com.wizarpos.devices.contactlesscard
Interface Target

All Known Subinterfaces:
TargetCPU, TargetMifare
public interface Target

The target object of the contactless card.

Method Summary
 byte[] connect()
          Connect the Target in order to get the ATR buffer.
 void disconnect()
          Sends a release request on the Target in order to inform it that the transaction is over.
 byte[] getID()
          Retrieves the identifier of the specified target.
 int getIndex()
          The index of this target, which start at 0.
 

Method Detail

getIndex

int getIndex()
The index of this target, which start at 0.

Returns:
the index of this target.

getID

byte[] getID()
Retrieves the identifier of the specified target.

This identifier enables the application to uniquely identify a Target in the given "session". This value, depending on the current mode ContactlessControl#getMode(), may not be time consistent, and may not match a device identifier.

The value is valid until the next call to scanTargets()

Returns:
a byte array to store the identifier

connect

byte[] connect()
               throws DeviceException
Connect the Target in order to get the ATR buffer.

This is an synchronous method.

Returns:
the buffer of the ATR
Throws:
DeviceException - for the standard reasons that are documented in DeviceException and also:
  • with code BAD_CONTROL_MODE - if no waitScanTargets or listenScanTargets has been performed or if disconnect() has already been performed on this target

disconnect

void disconnect()
                throws DeviceException
Sends a release request on the Target in order to inform it that the transaction is over.

This is an synchronous method.

Throws:
DeviceException - for the standard reasons that are documented in DeviceException and also:
  • with code BAD_CONTROL_MODE - if new waitScanTargets or listenScanTargets has been performed or if disconnect() has already been performed on this target
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if targetIndex is invalid according to the last scanTargets result; see InitiatorOperationEvent#getTargetIndexCount()
